main.name: Ben Anderson
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I am a young, aspiring Web Developer, as well as a space enthusiast.  I began a coding bootcamp, DevMountain, in September of 2019 without any prior coding experience. Rather quickly, I discovered that coding was something I really enjoyed. Since I started at the bootcamp, my overall knowledge of coding grows exponetially every single day.
main.contactmessage: Contact me for any business inquiries, a phone call is the best way to get in touch.

education.description: DevMountain teaches a 3 month long, fast-paced, Web Development course. In that time, I built two full-stack and one 3/4-stack web applications.

work.title: Group Project
work.description: Describe work, special projects, notable achievements, what technologies you have been working with, and anything else that would be useful for an employer to know.

work.title: Personal Project
work.description: A full-stack web app for all things movies and TV, inspired by IMDb. A user can create an account, search for movies, TV shows and actors, add their favorite movies / TV shows to a personal watchlist and purchase movie tickets. Technologies Used: React.js, Express-Session, JavaScript, Node.js, SASS, HTML, Firebase and Restful API's

work.title: Personal No Database Project
work.description: A 3/4-stack web app that allows the user to create their own FIFA card and sculpt their own ultimate team. Technologies Used: React.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Node.js and Express.

projects.title: BMDb
projects.category: A Movie and TV Show Database

projects.title: BUT Head
projects.category: FIFA Card and Ultimate Team Creator

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
